Reviews.Title: “Price/quality!”
Reviews.Author: Jerzy N
Reviews.Content: Sude Konak is definitely a good choice. The rooms are clean and nice. The breakfast was very good (it was possible to take it upstairs) and the staff was very helpful and friendly. This hotel is definitely a good pick and if again in Istanbul we will definitely come there back. Very good price/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: GintasG
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to main attractions. Very nice and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “More than my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Junaid H
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife travelled in the beginning of September for 6 nights. We had searched like a 100 or more hotels intially, since our budget was pretty tight. However, we finally came across Suke Konak. I never expected it to be even more than we saw what was in the pictures or the website. It was amazing and our experience here was extra ordinary, for a budget hotel as this one. The staff was excellent with us. Special thanks to Mr. Turgut Yazici and one more manager who was responsible for the day shift. The owner was very polite and helpful throughout my booking and stay at the hotel. Overall i loved the hospitality. They were always extra helpful to us for any questions or queries we put forward. The location is exactly what we wanted. Quiet and yet 1 min walk from the closest station (Gulhane). Walking distance from all the famous spots (Blue Mosque, Cistern, Haga Sophia, Spice Bazaar, etc). I would love to stay again here if i ever re-visited the place.

Reviews.Title: “a great affordable hotel located in the heart of old istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Omar D
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room for three nights that was very neat and tidy. The hotel is situated in the heart of old Istanbul close to all the major attractions and is a short walk to the promenade. The staff were extremely polite especially the front office manager Atakan Sahin. Do not miss out on breakfast as its simply delicious and will set you up for a busy day haggling with the various street and retail sellers. The food in the hotel is keenly priced and very appetising and is a lot better and cheaper than many of the food establishments which are along the main road.The management and staff will happily organise day excursions for you so you can be sure to see as much of Istanbul as your time allows. Be sure to book this hotel well in advance as it is very popular with international visitors as well as Turkish nationals. The hotel is reasonably priced and well worth the money. The room was cleaned and the bedding and towels changed every day. All rooms have air conditioning, mini bar,fridge and tv. We would strongly recommend this hotel and would certainly book again.

Reviews.Title: “well... it's a place to crash”
Reviews.Author: longsong
Reviews.Content: the best thing about this hotel is that it's close to a bunch of city attractions but that's about it, everything else is average, average, average it's clean enough, they change the towels and clean the room every day and stuff, yet still we had a nasty smell coming from the bathroom sometimes they're smoker-friendly they have a terrace on the roof which is supposed to be a restaurant, but when we were here it was only open for breakfasts breakfasts are scarce, the coffee is terrible the staff isn't particularly friendly, but not aggressive or rude either, helpful when necessary we booked a room with a double bed and they just moved two twin beds together. oh well. we stayed for a week and a half and paid 84 euros per night. probably could've found something better for the same money or even less, but we were too lazy to look and had to book something urgently the best rooms to book are on the 5th floor because they have a balcony with a sweet view and hagya sofia on the left. make sure you ask for street view or you might end up living in a room with windows facing a wall

Reviews.Title: “All Very Nice, unless......”
Reviews.Author: Dominic5
Reviews.Content: The star rating is, of course as usual, theirs. We had booked three months previously for a double room. On arrival it was two singles. No prob to change, but was the view facing the wall from the only window in the room and so no daylight ever, punishment for the complaint? Overall, and looking reviews in this area, it's same old, same old offering. It is one of so many of this type hotels in this square mile of touristic sleeping. Do not get me wrong, it is good value and the location is great. It is a powder-orange-juice-at breakfast hotel. I am sure you know what I mean.

Reviews.Title: “very comfatable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tomo2316
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. It takes only few minutes walk to Topkapi castle and 10 minutes to Blue Mosque etc. Room is not so big but very clean and comfortable. Our room had perfect view. Breakfast is good. Especially all of the hotel stuff are very nice and friendly. Everyday they say hello and made us glass of apple tea.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel !! Highly recommended....”
Reviews.Author: Oztiger111
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and the service was great with friendly and helpful staff. Booked through an agent in cannakale and noticed they give Australians a great price there, apparently more than if booked in Istanbul. Location great - breakfast acceptable - cleanliness no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mzwebby
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is nice, as it is close to the main attractions in historic Istanbul. The rooms don't have lots of frills, and are a bit cramped for 2 people. There is a shelf on the wall located just above the pillows, which if you're not careful, you'll end up banging your forehead into. The hotel was clean and staff were fairly helpful, though English was limited for some of the staff. A few of the rooms have balconies from which you get a great view of the Hagia Sophia at night. I would recommend the hotel, but I suspect there may be others even better in the area around.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, inviting, and in a great location”
Reviews.Author: jammindavs
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very accommodating to our needs. We appreciated the clean rooms. Enjoyed the breakfast on the 6th floor--great view!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Character... Not lots of space”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTim77
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was quaint and charming and had lots of character. The views from the terrace restaurant were spectacular. On clear mornings you could see across the Bosphorus one direction to Asia and to the Hagia Sofia in the other direction. Beautiful! Being right in the heart of Istanbul and yet able to take in the wonder of the city from a quiet, cafe like setting. The food is wonderful and the service first class. All the staff worked to address any questions or issues we encountered. They were a delight! Some of the rooms were VERY small. And I was in one of those:). Excuse the crassness, but to sit properly on the toilet I had to drape one leg into the shower. Other rooms I peeked in, though, were more spacious. Definitely ask for a room with a double-bed. I was in a room with 2 single beds and it was cramped. Still, I'd be most happy staying at this hotel again and even fine staying in the small room. But I would insist on a cheaper price.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful welcome and fantastic service in the heart of Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: ddavis9581
Reviews.Content: Location: Sude Konak is close to many sites. The location is ideal for enjoying the central city. Transportation options to any part of the city are available. Restaurants are numerous. Hotel: The hotel itself is clean and comfortable. The breakfast area offers a beautiful view over the city and the waterfront. Staff: The flexibility of the staff and their service was impeccable! Our wish was their demand. I cannot say enough. Istanbul: The city itself is absolutely amazing. The history was interesting. The food was incredible. The people were welcoming. Let's just say I'm in withdrawals for shish kabobs and baklava!

Reviews.Title: “The Sude Konak is just right.”
Reviews.Author: lamyr1
Reviews.Content: Great location, great terrace and the staff was keen in being of service to us. The breakfast table was perhaps one of the best we had the pleasure to enjoy during our trip. The Manager was very helpful and patient in giving us assistance or answering all of our questions. I have lost his card but we wish to thank him for all he did for us. The room was very comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to all points of interest in the Sultanahmet district. The tram is right at the corner. The restaurants around offer a turkish menu and are OK.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in great location”
Reviews.Author: LancasterLad
Reviews.Content: The Sude Konak is ideally located between Sirkeci and Sultanahmet, just a 2 minute walk from Gulhane tram stop, and round the corner from the North Shield pub. We arrived at the hotel from Ankara at 0900 expecting to be able to drop-off our luggage, and check-in after 1400. To our surprise our room was ready and we checked-in straight away. The lobby area is fairly open and comfortable, with a bar, easy chairs and free internet. Our room was on the 5th floor, which is where we asked for. Unfortunately we only had twin beds, but never mind! The room was a decent size, with mini-bar, a/c, and satellite TV. The bathroom was fine. Breakfast was buffet, with a decent choice. Breakfast was taken on the 6th floor roof terrace, which was partly open, partly enclosed. The views were very good without being breathtaking. We stayed for 3 nights, and had a good night sleep each night. The double glazing was of good quality, and we never once heard the call to prayers. We got a good deal booking through www.booking.com who we regularly use.

Reviews.Title: “100 m to Blue Mosque and very pleasant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Femaleperspective
Reviews.Content: Ebusuud Cad No 24, 34410 Sirkeci 0090 212 513 2100 This small boutique hotel is well placed for the main tourist part of the city being 400 m from the the Blue Mosque and 50 m from the tram which is excellent. It is small and personal and very clean. the furnishings are modern. There is no tea and coffee making facility in the room. The restaurant at the top of the building overlooks the Aya Sophia and the Bospherous so we moved up there for sessions on the laptop as well as for eating. My quality scores are based on what a small hotel should provide without swimming pool etc. and it is relief to be away from the large marbled type of hotel. The staff are very helpful and Reception understand English well. Opposite there is a pleasant restaurant called Turkish Kitchen, handy if you want to wear high heels one evening as Istanbul is not a city for anything but comfortable sensible shoes. My room lacked storage drawers and the wardrobe is very small. All the usual freebies are provided though. Rooms at the front suffer from road noise. Istanbul is truly one of the world's most interesting cities and highly recommended. On the negative side, I suggest an alcohol free holiday as even plonk is very expensive at up to Â£50 per bottle in an ordinary restaurant. There are lots of scams which you just come to expect. Lots of things are being quoted in euros now and we had to make some payments in euros. I have not seen any bad behaviour here and people give up their seats to women and the old. There are no drunks and no threatening yobs. Do not touch the cats. I was bitten by one being naturally drawn to felines. I decided to get rabies injections although it is very rare. If you do get it, it is fatal. The state hospital was tatty but quick and it was free. The private hospital I went to did not have the serum. Although we were on business, I preferred to be on this more interesting side of the city. The business side around Taksim is much like every other city. Tea: ask for English tea with cold milk (sot).

Reviews.Title: “good, clean, well organised and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: dreamtemplar
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Sude on numerous occasions, its our hotel of choice when going to lovely Istanbul. It is clean and professional. Staff all very nice and helpful. Excellent chai and a good breakfast. Haven't checked out the restaurant yet in all my times there, as I'm always back too late, but it looks very popular, esp in the summer when you have a wonderful view of the Haija Sophia. Anyway, the rooms are well laid out, warm and cosy in the extremely cold winters and cool in the summer. Bathroom again , all good things to say. Good internet connection too. Should be starred, I have stayed in worse 4 starts in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but functional, needs better aircon!”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Ireland
Reviews.Content: I made a last minute booking on arrival in istanbul, and they were very accommodating with a 9am check in, and offered me free breakfast that morning. Breakfast is simple but good quality. Fresh squeezed OJ is 1.5 euro a glass. The rooms are small, but have satellite channels, free wifi ( can crash a bit and bandwidth can be quite narow at times) and air conditioning ( not great at chilling the room, but does stop the temperature rising through the night. Street noise is a major issue with open windows, but the double glazing is an excellent soundproofer). It is very close to a regular tram stop and the sights are all a few minutes away. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again for its value for money and location.

Reviews.Title: “good value clean hotel, in good location for main historical sites/trams”
Reviews.Author: AndreaSussex_England
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Air con is unreliable, but this is easily solved by opening windows; out of high season this would not be an issue anyway. There are comments about inadequate breakfast from earlier travellers, I do not believe these were justified: buffet consisted of. 4 x fresh fruit, 5 x cheese, 1 type of meat, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, 3 x bread, 2 x savoury pastries, 5 x jam/honey, 4 x breakfast cereals. Tea, coffee and chilled water on tap. All for 60 euro night for a triple room. Wifi worked very well, router on every floor

Reviews.Title: “NÄ±ce clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: omrish
Reviews.Content: Sude Konak is a nice clean hotel. Aircondition and safety deposit is included in the prÄ±ce which is good. Breakfast is not the best I have had, but at least something to start the day with. I would defÄ±nately come back to the hotel due to the good location and the fact that it is clean. 4/5 would be my rating!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with all basic facilities,great place to spend leisure time.”
Reviews.Author: munif
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, great staff,reasonable breakfast,very clean,daily housekeeping,mini-bar,t-v with cable,a-c,toiletteries,ideal location for tourists,are the compliments for this hotel.I will definately come back to this place,whenever i am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended, handy for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Bloom_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the start of a tour. Good location, very handy for the main sights in Istanbul. Clean rooms, reasonable size for a city hotel. Nice roof top restaurant. Staff polite & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “sude konak”
Reviews.Author: wafaMarrakech
Reviews.Content: In general the hotel is the perfect emlacement super!, staff lovely and helpful Gihan especially handsome it is so nice ... no comment.........

Reviews.Title: “Sude Konak good for families”
Reviews.Author: Bob_DeBean
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (two boys aged 10 & 7) stayed here in July 2009 for 3 nights. The hotel was contacted by email to confirm the price nad it was a real bargain - I won't say how much exactly but it was less than Â£150 which was for 2 rooms ( 2 singles in each) collection and drop off to the air port & breakfast ! Collection went smoothly and registration on arrival was very quick. Rooms were simple affairs, nice and clean with en suites. TV only has one english speaking channel, the rest being in Turkish. Wifi access is available at no charge plus in the reception there is a computer also free to use. Beds were made each day and were comfy. Rooms had air con and the ones I had were street facing on the second floor room 211 & 213. There is a fair bit of street noise, but nothing I would not expect staying in any major city. There is a nice roof restuarant which we didn't use but it had some nice views. The main tourist attractions are all within walking distance. The blue mosque and Ayia Sofia as si the tokapi palace, the Byzantine cistern and the Harbour. One irriatiting thing is the amount times you get propositioned to eat iin a restaurant whenever you so much as come within 50 yards of one. Tip - ask the price before you buy, we got ripped off eating at a place called Urfa' Live as we were shown menu's without all prices on them and then some imaginary tac was added on top. The harbour was pleasant and I would thorughly recommend a boat ride across the bosphorous. I cost us 10 lira each (Â£4.20)with my 7 year old going free as he did so in every attraction we went to. I used Lira to pay for most things, as often if you use Euros you get ripped off, i.e. the price for somethoing may be 5EURO but then when you say you want to pay in Lira they still say 5 which is about half the price. There is a MacDonalds and Burger king, although the service is not very fast and prices are somewhat dear. Also I noted that english was not very widely spoken, however I managed to get through without any major difficulties. On the whole Istanbul is great to visit and the Sude Konak is excellently positioned, would I stay there agin - definitley - the kids were a bit noisy playing in reception but staff never complained.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: FrequentlyFlying16
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week, then traveled to Canakkale, Troy and Assos for a week, came back to Sude Konak for two more days. Stay away from this hotel. If we had not already paid, we would not have come back. The hotel staff tried to book us a taxi to the airport for 50 Lira, when the cost is actually 30-35. On European websites, there is a long history of staff being very rude and uncooperative. I know exactly who they are talking about. Stay at Harmony or Romance Hotel. They are equally well located and give better service. Air conditioning and WiFi are spotty. Photos of rooms are misleading. They are small and dirty, too. The hotel is definitely not "hip". Also, you get a 20% better rate if you book through a European hotel website. The location and view from the hotel terrace restaurant are true, however. But, it is not worth more than $40-45/night. Be prepared to swelter in the rooms at night in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff; great location”
Reviews.Author: FredWilliamson
Reviews.Content: The friendliness of the staff is my best memory. In the life (elevator) don't press "6".. it doesn't work, plus the lift lights go out. Scary.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: DoumeLondon
Reviews.Content: The location is great, though you might be able to find better location in charming Beyoglu or busy Taksim, but very close to Topkapi, Blue Mosquee... the staff was very friendly. We had to change 3 times of room in 1 week, the first one was leading to the street and very noisy, also you can hear the staff chating and slaming doors early morning. In the second room we stayed half an hour! next door someone was snoring like if a bear was sleeping with us (no joking). We ended up on the last floor, in a tiny room with a tiny window, dark but quite quiet. The breakfast is big but not very tasty. We had a good deal on the Internet (252 euros for a week for 2 people) but you might be able to find better deal in a quieter road - or ask for top floor and not leading to the street. Enjoy Istanbul !!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANT STAY”
Reviews.Author: rajanSingapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days with my family here,the hotel was situated in a fantastic location of Istanbul,where most of the tourist location can be reached by foot.Its is a family run hotel with very kind and helpful staff who are always ready to assit you with all your needs,the owner of the hotel Mr Sejuck Perek was a very kind and firendly person who make a point to see the all his customers to make sure they were happy with their stay in his hotel.Also the fantastic employees in the front office who were there to help to all your need the Manager Mr.Turgut,Mr.Yadigar and Mr.Atakan will always answer your quries and help you in booking and planning any tour or assistance you need in going around the great city of Istanbul.SO IF YOU ARE GOING TO iSTANBUL PLS GIVE A TOUGHT TO sudee konak for your memorable stay. Mr.Rajan Singapore rajan@nx-era.com

Reviews.Title: “Sent here from the Erboy”
Reviews.Author: LondonAnn
Reviews.Content: I originally booked at the Erboy only to find they had transferred me here with no adequate explanation. Apparently this was an 'upgrade' to a 4* hotel. The reception and rooms were very utilitarian. The best thing about this area is the location. All the attractions are within walking distance and there is a nice terrace restaurant which serves OK food, good for a summer's evening. There are a couple of shops facing the hotel including an internet cafe which is open late. They serve light snacks and drinks and is priced reasonably, as is the internet facilities. Stay away from the souviner shops though - the prices are shocking!

Reviews.Title: “Mutton dressed as Lamb!”
Reviews.Author: highlandtom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for a short break right in the middle of Old Istanbul. It is walking distance to the Blue Mosque and a tram ride from the new City. The staff are friendly and the wireless internet access is free and fast enough. How the hotel ever got a 4* rating is beyond me... Ok, so it is clean enough and the staff are friendly, however, the rooms are little better than a glorified hostel. If you get a room at the back of the hotel (a 50-50 chance...) you will have no natural light to speak of, a tiny window you are better off leaving closed and a tiny space around your bed.. The rooms are noisy with paper thin walls and I ended up unplugging my mini-bar (only to hear the one in the room next to me!). Breakfast is ok... not great but ok. Buffet style but not a lot of choice. I guess I got what I paid for. If I had paid 4* prices and got the Sude Konak, I would NOT be happy at all!!! The Hotel is probably closer to 2* standard. Don't be tempted to pay 4* money - you will be dissapointed. As it was, I got a comfortable bed at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Located in a great area”
Reviews.Author: ARL-Sydney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Istanbul after a long international flight. The reception staff were welcoming and helpful, later however not speaking Turkish became a problem for us. Our room was very small but very clean. The bathroom was adequate but in need of renovating. The room faced the street but there was no problem with street noise. Breakfast was great. Views of Istanbul from the roof were outstanding. Anyone staying in this hotel must visit the roof area. The location of the hotel was very good we were able to walk to a number of interesting places.

Reviews.Title: “Sude Konak, never again”
Reviews.Author: JND1964
Reviews.Content: I was sent to this hotel, as the one I booked couldn't accommodate me (without any reason given to me) Please don't look at the picture Sude Konak on their websites. What you see on the website has nothing to do with what is in front of you when you are there. I got room 201 at Sude Konak. A box with walking space around the bed only. The only window that you could open is surrounded by 3 walls and water/sewerage pipes run all the way throuhg. The best solution, to close the window. On the first night, at 2.00 in the morning, there were teenagers making noise, I really mean noise, in their rooms and in the corridor, screaming. Nobody would tell them to remain quiet as decent guests are sleeping. At 04.00, there was a terrible noise in the breakfast room. Some were up for breakfast (it was Ramadan time) and the phone in the reception would ring very loud several times, nobody would pick it, you would hear cuttelry, plates, screaming until 06.30am, at which time I would be authorised to have some sleep, before others wake up and go for breakfast at 08.00am. There is a lack of respect over there. Everyone is free to follow his/her religion and do what he/she wants. But one has to make sure that this freedom doesn't intrude in other people's private life and intimacy. I had that for 3 nights

Reviews.Title: “I definitely recommend Sude Konak”
Reviews.Author: AlexDItaly
Reviews.Content: Sude Konak is perfectly located at walking distance from the main touristic attractions of the city. Both the common and private areas are consistently nice, well maintained and adequate. Breakfast is a pleasant experience. The staff is professional, kind and helpful. The hotel has many shops in the immediate surroundings including a couple of city center supermarkets, convenient and cheap for snacks and bath items you forgot to take with you. Plenty of food options within 100m including low-cost good quality restaurants. For Istanbul hotels I suggest not to use the website form booking, requiring you to give out your credit card info. Many hotels in Istanbul accept email booking. Negotiate a good rate, give your name and address and notify any delay in arrival time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, Great Staff & Location & Safe”
Reviews.Author: Egyptiannn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our One week stay earlier this month at the Sude Konak in Istanbul. This Hotel was wonderful in so many ways. I spent a good month trying to find the perfect hotel for our stay and budget. The way it is in Istanbul is that there are very few world-recognized brands and that the majority of hotels are small houses, buildings turned into hotels. Here are the reasons why I will be returning to the Sude Konak on my next trip to Istanbul: Location: Perfect! Its situated only a few meters from most attractions in sultan ahmet - So ther ewas never a shortage of things to do or see. (Ie. Taksim is great because of the square, isteklal street, but very modern and can get a bit borning for those looking to get the full Turkish experience, Aksary (whom our travel agent had offered to get us accomodations is a BAD idea for tourists, especially for safety, and lack of things to do or see, although it could be a bit more affordable its about 15min away from sultanahmet by tram (which stops operating at aruond midnight) Staff: Where phenomenal - Simply put helped us in every way. Yadigar was most helpful, well informed of the city, and was able to provide us with information needed for tours, recomendations, and even helped us plan a few out of the city excursions. Safety: We were three girls travelling, and Istanbul as great as it is, after 10pm streets tend to quiet down and Safety was a concern for us. The nice thing about Sude konak, is because its in a slightly busier area of the city, hence we were able to stay out until 11...12 MAX. Also, its a few steps away from the Tram stop of "Guhlane" making it easier and safer for us to come home late at night, without having to pass by roads less travelled. Cleanliness: I found our rooms to be very clean, well maintained, same with restaurant (beautiful Patio restaurant overlooking Aya Sofia) and Breakfast area. Breakfast: was delicious, a traditional turkish style breakfast. Price value: All included we got a great value for our money!! Sude Konak was definetly a great choice for us!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: annbentsjord
Reviews.Content: We were 3 persons staying for one week in a tripple room. It was absolutly ok. After this first week we stayed 2 persons in the same room. The service from the staff was grate and always with a smile and a willingness of helping. The staff is also very polite and always ready to help if you ask them. The terrasse is a wonderful place with a wiew and atmosfare that only is in your dreams. The food on the hotel is among the best. Spesial the food from the grill. Rooms and bathrooms are quite ok. They clean the rooms every day. We have absolutly nothing to complaine about the cleaning. A very big pluss is that the hotel is located in the middle of everything. You can walk to the most populare places. Grand bazar, Blue moskÃ¨, Hagia Sofia are all in a distance of 5 - 10 minutes by walking. I have the best holiday in Istanbul this time and that is also according to the hotel and its staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Sude Konak Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ebusuut 24 34412 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
